[color=Green][b]English:[/b][/color] 
In 1986 they recorded their first demo called Noches Agitadas en el Cementerio. In 1988, a self-named album was released. After three years of recording, a second album was released called Nena de Hiroshima. After the second album Fidel was invited to collaborate with Mano Negra. Along with Manu Chao and the rest of Mano Negra, they went to Colombia where they recorded La Casa Babylon.


[color=Green][b]EspaÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â±ol:[/b][/color]
In 1994, Todos Tus Muertos recorded Dale Aborigen which featured Manu Chao, FermÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â­n Muguruza of Negu Gorriak, and also band members of Los Fabulosos Cadillacs and Los AutÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©nticos Decadentes. In this record there was a mixture Reggae, Hip Hop, Punk and other Latin rhythms. With this album they did an international tour which included Mexico, Peru, Panama, Puerto Rico, the United States, France, Spain and Colombia.

In 1997, they founded TTM Discos, an independent music label, which included band like Cienfuegos, Karamelo Santo and Lumumba.
